frontmatter.title: Routines
frontmatter.description: There is balance between having and not having a routine. Having a routine can help you make progress. Not having a routine allows you to explore and find new sources of inspiration.

frontmatter.title: Life after school
frontmatter.description: After school, effort and results don't necessarily correlate. For many things, results are binary. Either you succeed or you don't.

frontmatter.title: Media is a distraction
frontmatter.description: Mainstream media serves as a distraction that diverts attention away from more pressing matters.

frontmatter.title: Building a personal UBI
frontmatter.description: Why wait for Universal Basic Income (UBI) when you can create it for yourself? What would you do with the freedom and flexibility it offered you?

frontmatter.title: Advice for creating on the internet
frontmatter.description: Creating anything on the internet has extremely high leverage. The internet turns a linear amount of work into an exponential amount of value.

frontmatter.title: The illusion of stability
frontmatter.description: Stability is an illusion. School, work, relationships and life are always in flux.

frontmatter.title: Rene Girard's Mimetic Desire
frontmatter.description: What you desire is imitated from observing what others desire or have.

frontmatter.title: The Sovereign Individual: Megapolitics
frontmatter.description: Megapolitics attempts to extract major structural patterns that repeat throughout history. The factors leading to megapolitical change include topography, climate, microbes and technology.

frontmatter.title: Balance inputs and outputs
frontmatter.description: Knowledge without application is useless. However, in a complex world abundant in information, it is easy to get overwhelmed into inaction.Â
